title: Authors and Citation
text: Guillaume Noblet. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Noblet G (2025). ggbranding: Add personal branding ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons. R package version 1.0.0, https://gnoblet.github.io/ggbranding.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggbranding: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons},   author = {Guillaume Noblet},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://gnoblet.github.io/ggbranding}, }

what: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
text: Add personal branding ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons Key Features: üöÄ Auto Font Setup - Automatically downloads Font Awesome 7 fonts first use üé® 500+ Icons - Access Font Awesome brand communication icons üéØ One Function Call - Add complete branding add_branding() üé® Customizable - Brand colors, custom text, styling options üì¶ Lightweight - Efficient font caching quite minimal dependencies

title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
text: Install development version GitHub:
code: # library(pak) pak::pak("gnoblet/ggbranding") # CRAN version to come

title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
text: ‚Äôs ! function automatically: Downloads sets Font Awesome 7 fonts Applies ggtext::element_textbox_simple() theme Creates HTML-formatted captions icons Handles text sanitization grid rendering
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggtext) library(ggbranding) library(showtext) #> Loading required package: sysfonts #> Loading required package: showtextdb library(sysfonts)  # setup dpi showtext::showtext_opts(dpi = 300)  # add branding with + in ggplot chain ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt)) +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "My Awesome Plot") +   add_branding(     github = "gnoblet",     bluesky = "@gnoblet",     linkedin = "gnoblet"   )

title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
text: Use + ggplot chain:
code: # With additional text before branding, custom spacing and blue colors ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width)) +   geom_point() +   add_branding(     github = "gnoblet",     bluesky = "@gnoblet",     additional_text = "Data source: iris dataset",     text_position = "before",     line_spacing = 2L, # double line breaks for extra space     icon_color = "blue",     text_color = "blue",     additional_text_color = "darkgrey"   ) # With custom styling and Roboto Condensed font font_add_google("Monoton", "monoton") ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt)) +   geom_point() +   add_branding(     github = "GNOBLET",     bluesky = "@GNOBLET",     caption_halign = 1, # right-align caption     icon_size = "12pt", # larger icons     text_size = "12pt", # larger text,     text_family = "monoton", # custom font     caption_margin = ggplot2::margin(t = 20, b = 5, unit = "pt") # custom margin   ) # Use custom icons ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt)) +   geom_point() +   add_branding(     github = "gnoblet",     bluesky = "@gnoblet",     custom_icons = c(       envelope = "gnoblet@fake.news",       rss = "gnoblet.github.io"     )   ) #> No icon found for platform 'rss', using generic link icon with following #> unicode: 'xf0c1'.

title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
text: Built-support major platforms:

title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
text: Access 500+ Font Awesome icons custom_icons. list search available icons:
code: # Discover available icons list_available_icons() |> head(5)  # Search for specific icons list_available_icons(search = "envelope")

title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
code: # 1. Icons not displaying fa_setup(auto_download = TRUE)  # 2. Clear cache if fonts seem corrupted clear_font_cache_dir(confirm = FALSE)  # 3. Check available icons head(list_available_icons())  # 4. Test basic functionality branding(github = "test")

title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
code: library(sysfonts) library(showtext)  # Download Font Awesome 7 from https://fontawesome.com/download # Extract and use the Brands font file sysfonts::font_add(   family = "Font Awesome 7 Brands",   regular = "path/to/Font-Awesome-7-Brands-Regular-400.otf" ) sysfonts::font_add(   family = "Font Awesome 7 Free",   regular = "path/to/Font-Awesome-7-Free-Solid-900.otf" ) showtext::showtext_auto()  # Then use with setup_fonts = FALSE branding(github = "username", setup_fonts = FALSE)

title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
text: GPL v3 later. See LICENSE file details.

title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
code: citation("ggbranding")

title: Add personal branding to ggplot2 charts using Font Awesome 7 icons
text: Inspired Nicola Rennie‚Äôs blog post Font Awesome team marvelous icoms R community ggplot2, ggtext, ecosystem packages Made ‚ô• Font Awesome 7 ‚Ä¢ Add branding today!

what: Add Complete Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî add_branding
title: Add Complete Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî add_branding
text: function creates ggplot2 layer can added + apply theme styling (using element_textbox_simple ggtext) branded captions ggplot2 charts.

title: Add Complete Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî add_branding
code: add_branding(   github = NULL,   gitlab = NULL,   linkedin = NULL,   bluesky = NULL,   twitter = NULL,   mastodon = NULL,   orcid = NULL,   email = NULL,   website = NULL,   custom_icons = NULL,   additional_text = NULL,   text_position = "before",   line_spacing = 1L,   icon_color = "#666666",   text_color = "#333333",   icon_size = "8pt",   text_size = "8pt",   line_height = "1.2",   text_family = NULL,   additional_text_color = NULL,   additional_text_size = NULL,   setup_fonts = TRUE,   caption_width = NULL,   caption_halign = 0,   caption_margin = NULL )

title: Add Complete Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî add_branding
text: github (NULL | character(1)) GitHub username (optional) gitlab (NULL | character(1)) GitLab username (optional) linkedin (NULL | character(1)) LinkedIn username (optional) bluesky (NULL | character(1)) Bluesky handle (optional) twitter (NULL | character(1)) Twitter/X handle (optional) mastodon (NULL | character(1)) Mastodon handle (optional) orcid (NULL | character(1)) ORCID ID (optional) email (NULL | character(1)) Email address (optional) website (NULL | character(1)) Website URL (optional) custom_icons (NULL | character) Named vector additional icon names usernames (optional). Names match icons icons_df. additional_text (NULL | character(1)) Additional text include caption (e.g., "Data source: XYZ") text_position (character(1)) Position additional text relative branding. Either "" "". (default: "") line_spacing (integer(1)) Number line breaks additional text icons (1-3). (default: 1) icon_color (character(1)) Color icons. (default: "#666666") text_color (character(1)) Color usernames/text. (default: "#333333") icon_size (character(1)) Font size icons. (default: "8pt") text_size (character(1)) Font size text/usernames. (default: "8pt") line_height (character(1)) Line height caption. (default: "1.2") text_family (NULL | character(1)) Font family text/usernames. (default: NULL uses system default) additional_text_color (NULL | character(1)) Color additional text. NULL, uses text_color. (default: NULL) additional_text_size (NULL | character(1)) Font size additional text. NULL, uses text_size. (default: NULL) setup_fonts (logical(1)) Whether automatically setup Font Awesome fonts. (default: TRUE) caption_width (NULL | character(1)) Width specification caption text box (default: NULL uses ggtext default) caption_halign (numeric(1)) Horizontal alignment caption (0 = left, 0.5 = center, 1 = right). (default: 0) caption_margin (NULL | ggplot2::margin) Margin specification caption (default: NULL uses ggtext default)

title: Add Complete Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî add_branding
text: (list) list ggplot2 components can added +

title: Add Complete Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî add_branding
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2) library(ggtext) library(ggbranding)  # Use with + in ggplot chain ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt)) +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "My Plot") +   add_branding(     github = "yourusername",     linkedin = "yourprofile"   )  # With additional text ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width)) +   geom_point() +   add_branding(     github = "yourusername",     additional_text = "Data source: iris dataset",     text_position = "before"   )  # With custom icons and styling ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt)) +   geom_point() +   add_branding(     github = "yourusername",     custom_icons = c(       envelope = "contact@example.com",       globe = "https://mywebsite.com"     ),     caption_halign = 1   ) } # }

what: Add Personal Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî branding
title: Add Personal Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî branding
text: function creates formatted caption social media icons usernames can easily added ggplot2 charts personal branding.

title: Add Personal Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî branding
code: branding(   github = NULL,   gitlab = NULL,   linkedin = NULL,   bluesky = NULL,   twitter = NULL,   mastodon = NULL,   orcid = NULL,   email = NULL,   website = NULL,   custom_icons = NULL,   additional_text = NULL,   text_position = "before",   line_spacing = 1L,   icon_color = "#666666",   text_color = "#333333",   icon_size = "8pt",   text_size = "8pt",   line_height = "1.2",   text_family = NULL,   additional_text_color = NULL,   additional_text_size = NULL,   setup_fonts = TRUE )

title: Add Personal Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî branding
text: github (NULL | character(1)) GitHub username (optional) gitlab (NULL | character(1)) GitLab username (optional) linkedin (NULL | character(1)) LinkedIn username (optional) bluesky (NULL | character(1)) Bluesky handle (optional) twitter (NULL | character(1)) Twitter/X handle (optional) mastodon (NULL | character(1)) Mastodon handle (optional) orcid (NULL | character(1)) ORCID ID (optional) email (NULL | character(1)) Email address (optional) website (NULL | character(1)) Website URL (optional) custom_icons (NULL | character) Named vector additional icon names usernames (optional). Names match icons icons_df. additional_text (NULL | character(1)) Additional text include caption (e.g., "Data source: XYZ") text_position (character(1)) Position additional text relative branding. Either "" "". (default: "") line_spacing (integer(1)) Number line breaks additional text icons (1-3). (default: 1) icon_color (character(1)) Color icons. (default "#666666") text_color (character(1)) Color usernames/text. (default: "#333333") icon_size (character(1)) Font size icons. (default: "8pt") text_size (character(1)) Font size text/usernames. (default: "8pt") line_height (character(1)) Line height caption. (default: "1.2") text_family (NULL | character(1)) Font family text/usernames. (default: NULL uses system default) additional_text_color (NULL | character(1)) Color additional text. NULL, uses text_color. (default: NULL) additional_text_size (NULL | character(1)) Font size additional text. NULL, uses text_size. (default: NULL) setup_fonts (logical(1)) Whether automatically setup Font Awesome fonts. (default: TRUE)

title: Add Personal Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî branding
text: (character(1)) character string containing HTML-formatted caption text

title: Add Personal Branding to ggplot2 Charts ‚Äî branding
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2) library(ggtext)  # Basic usage with GitHub and LinkedIn caption <- branding(github = "yourusername", linkedin = "yourprofile")  ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt)) +   geom_point() +   labs(caption = caption) +   theme(plot.caption = ggtext::element_textbox_simple())  # With additional text and custom spacing caption <- branding(   github = "yourusername",   linkedin = "yourprofile",   additional_text = "Data source: mtcars dataset",   text_position = "before",   line_spacing = 2L,   icon_color = "steelblue",   text_color = "steelblue" )  # With custom icons from icons_df caption <- branding(   github = "yourusername",   custom_icons = c(     envelope = "contact@example.com",     globe = "https://mywebsite.com",     rss = "myblog"   ) ) } # }

title: Clear Font Cache ‚Äî clear_font_cache_dir
text: Removes cached Font Awesome fonts free space force re-download.

title: Clear Font Cache ‚Äî clear_font_cache_dir
code: clear_font_cache_dir(confirm = TRUE)

title: Clear Font Cache ‚Äî clear_font_cache_dir
text: confirm (logical(1)) Whether ask confirmation deleting cached files. (default: TRUE)

title: Clear Font Cache ‚Äî clear_font_cache_dir
text: (logical(1)) TRUE cache cleared successfully, FALSE otherwise.

title: Clear Font Cache ‚Äî clear_font_cache_dir
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clear font cache clear_font_cache_dir()  # Clear without confirmation clear_font_cache_dir(confirm = FALSE) } # }

title: Download Font Awesome Fonts ‚Äî fa_download
text: Downloads Font Awesome fonts official GitHub releases already cached.

title: Download Font Awesome Fonts ‚Äî fa_download
code: fa_download(version = "7.0.1", force_download = FALSE, quiet = FALSE)

title: Download Font Awesome Fonts ‚Äî fa_download
text: version (character(1)) Font Awesome version download semantic versioning format. Must match pattern. (default: "7.0.1") force_download (logical(1)) Whether force re-download even cached. (default: FALSE) quiet (logical(1)) Whether suppress download messages. (default: FALSE)

title: Download Font Awesome Fonts ‚Äî fa_download
text: (list) Named list paths downloaded font files ('brands' 'free_solid'), NULL values download failed.

title: Download Font Awesome Fonts ‚Äî fa_download
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download latest Font Awesome fonts font_paths <- fa_download() } # }

what: Download Single Font Awesome Font Type ‚Äî fa_download_single
title: Download Single Font Awesome Font Type ‚Äî fa_download_single
text: Helper function download specific Font Awesome font type.

title: Download Single Font Awesome Font Type ‚Äî fa_download_single
code: fa_download_single(font_type, version, force_download, quiet)

title: Download Single Font Awesome Font Type ‚Äî fa_download_single
text: font_type (character(1)) Font type download: "brands" "free_solid" version (character(1)) Font Awesome version download semantic versioning format force_download (logical(1)) Whether force re-download even cached quiet (logical(1)) Whether suppress download messages

title: Download Single Font Awesome Font Type ‚Äî fa_download_single
text: (character(1) | NULL) Character string path downloaded font file, NULL download failed.

what: Setup Font Awesome Fonts with Auto-Download ‚Äî fa_setup
title: Setup Font Awesome Fonts with Auto-Download ‚Äî fa_setup
text: Automatically sets Font Awesome fonts, downloading necessary. Sets Brands Free Solid font families.

title: Setup Font Awesome Fonts with Auto-Download ‚Äî fa_setup
code: fa_setup(auto_download = TRUE, version = "7.0.1", quiet = FALSE)

title: Setup Font Awesome Fonts with Auto-Download ‚Äî fa_setup
text: auto_download (logical(1)) Whether automatically download fonts found. (default: TRUE) version (character(1)) Font Awesome version use semantic versioning format. Must match pattern. (default: "7.0.1") quiet (logical(1)) Whether suppress messages setup. (default: FALSE)

title: Setup Font Awesome Fonts with Auto-Download ‚Äî fa_setup
text: (logical(1)) TRUE fonts successfully loaded, FALSE otherwise.

title: Setup Font Awesome Fonts with Auto-Download ‚Äî fa_setup
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Setup fonts with auto-download fa_setup()  # Setup without auto-download fa_setup(auto_download = FALSE) } # }

title: Get Font Cache Directory ‚Äî get_font_cache_dir
text: Returns package directory Font Awesome fonts /cached.

title: Get Font Cache Directory ‚Äî get_font_cache_dir
code: get_font_cache_dir()

title: Get Font Cache Directory ‚Äî get_font_cache_dir
text: (character(1)) Absolute path Font Awesome fonts cache directory.

title: Get Font Cache Directory ‚Äî get_font_cache_dir
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get font cache directory cache_dir <- get_font_cache_dir() print(cache_dir) } # }

title: Icons Data ‚Äî icons_df
text: comprehensive dataset social media platform icons brand colors. Generated multiple online sources including Font Awesome, Simple Icons, Brand Colors.

title: Icons Data ‚Äî icons_df
code: icons_df

title: Icons Data ‚Äî icons_df
text: list following components: icons Named list Unicode HTML entities social media icons colors Named list hex color codes brand colors font_family Font family name icon rendering last_updated POSIXct timestamp data generation sources Character string data sources used generation_info List generation metadata

title: Icons Data ‚Äî icons_df
text: Font Awesome: https://fontawesome.com/ Simple Icons: https://simpleicons.org/ Brand Colors: https://brandcolors.net/

title: Icons Data ‚Äî icons_df
code: # Access GitHub icon icons_df$icons$github #> NULL  # Access Spotify brand color icons_df$colors$spotify #> NULL  # List all available platforms names(icons_df$icons) #> NULL  # Check when data was last updated icons_df$last_updated #> NULL  # View data sources icons_df$sources #> NULL

title: List Available Icons ‚Äî list_available_icons
text: Shows available icons icons_df dataset can used custom_icons parameter branding() add_branding() functions.

title: List Available Icons ‚Äî list_available_icons
code: list_available_icons(search = NULL, show_unicode = FALSE, show_styles = FALSE)

title: List Available Icons ‚Äî list_available_icons
text: search (NULL | character(1)) Optional search term filter icons name, label, search terms (optional) show_unicode (logical(1)) Whether show Unicode values icons. (default: FALSE) show_styles (logical(1)) Whether show icon styles (brands, solid, etc.). (default: FALSE)

title: List Available Icons ‚Äî list_available_icons
text: (data.frame) data frame available icons metadata

title: List Available Icons ‚Äî list_available_icons
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all available icons list_available_icons()  # Search for communication-related icons list_available_icons(search = "envelope")  # Search for social media icons list_available_icons(search = "github")  # Show with Unicode values list_available_icons(search = "twitter", show_unicode = TRUE)  # Show with styles information list_available_icons(search = "phone", show_styles = TRUE) } # }

what: Sanitize Character Strings for HTML Rendering ‚Äî sanitize_chr
title: Sanitize Character Strings for HTML Rendering ‚Äî sanitize_chr
text: Adds zero-width spaces problematic characters prevent HTML tag auto-detection grid text rendering.

title: Sanitize Character Strings for HTML Rendering ‚Äî sanitize_chr
code: sanitize_chr(x)

title: Sanitize Character Strings for HTML Rendering ‚Äî sanitize_chr
text: x (character) Character vector sanitize

title: Sanitize Character Strings for HTML Rendering ‚Äî sanitize_chr
text: (character) Sanitized character vector zero-width spaces added

title: Sanitize Character Strings for HTML Rendering ‚Äî sanitize_chr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Sanitize email addresses sanitize_chr("contact@example.com")  # Sanitize URLs with forward slashes sanitize_chr("https://example.com/path")  # Handle vectors sanitize_chr(c("user@domain.com", "path/to/file")) } # }
